data.description:
üåç Bloom Network helps people discover and spearhead grassroots climate actions where they live, with the support of a platform owned and governed directly by them! With Local Hubs, local media feeds, and a peer-to-peer incubator powered by Web3, we empower people to start and grow projects from A to Z with the support of a passionate global community. [https://bloomnetwork.earth](https://bloomnetwork.earth/)

We began in 2008, hosting skillshares and an online network strategizing about what‚Äôs next after Occupy Wall Street. We‚Äôre thrilled to be meshing with the Web3 community, watering the gardens of the dreams we seeded then!! All thanks to your contributions on Gitcoin. Read on to see what we‚Äôve created with your support, and please share our grant widely. ‚ù§Ô∏è


## The Infinite Garden in Real Life

Imagine if Facebook was owned and governed by its members - individuals and Local impact coalitions - and its groups feature was designed to be a regenerative projects incubator, using the latest web3 fintech. That‚Äôs Bloom!

üåΩ Today, we are 30,000 people strong on the ground in 26 Local Bloom Hubs across 11 countries, doing climate repair and adaptation as a voluntary network. Food security is the most common thing we work on, building regional food movements that build local markets and peer-to-peer subsidization of agroecology farming. From 10,000 person local food festivals, to market advocacy for local farms, to training over 70,000 children how to grow permaculture gardens. We are scaling up global regeneration led by rooted local communities, and affixing permanent economic sovereignty!

üíß Watershed care is the next most common thing we do - projects like Ogallala Life and Diamante Bridge Collective leading the way with water installations that slow down flow to repair aquifers, reduce flooding risk, and break down toxins that might otherwise flow into our precious waterways. Over time, a Local Bloom weaves permanent relationships between different movements in a region: water, food, economy, justice, and the arts.

üï∏Ô∏è  Bloom‚Äôs groundbreaking digital platform was crafted with love and dedication by over 100 local community organizers, making it a true local-first media network. Dive into your local media feed, where you can discover what‚Äôs happening in your community and actively participate. Search gifts and requests for gift economy or for hire exchange. Make your local impact work more visible by posting on Bloom, and receive grants and profits as our collective attracts them. **It's an "always on" form of retroactive public goods funding, designed by local communities on the ground, to bridge the capital gap to grassroots-led climate repair.**

Here is a [video walkthrough](https://www.loom.com/share/b8e2230398c64034b7514838bcf6e8ac) of our features and the rewards.

![testimonials.png](https://i.postimg.cc/hPg7R61s/testimonials.png)


## Progress

Completed since GG18, with $3,100:

* [Smart contracts for RAP - Regenerative Actions Protocol](https://www.inverter.network/post/bloom-x-inverter-building-a-regenerative-action-bounty-system-for-local-communities), an open impact framework for communities to self-define what is valuable to them in repairing local climate, social, and economic justice issues. Read more below.
* Welcomed new Local Bloom hubs in the Philippines (Indigenous-led!), Sicily (Rifai Sicilia!), Turkey (Earthist!), and reactivated Bloom Boulder.
* In-app member onboarding that orients people to Bloom and our community values and connects them with their path.
* Submitted our federal US tax exemption to improve our collective access to traditional grants. Developed our traditional grants approach to build the funding pool that directly supports the work of Local Blooms while professionalizing their impact documentation skills.
 
**Why Bloom's Smart Contracts Are Amazing!**

The culmination of 16 years of global community R&D analyzing systemic finance gaps and grassroots solutions! Developed in partnership with Integral Network, they use an upgradable smart contracts module with an open bounties system. Members report their impactful actions, and once verified, rewards go not only to them as individuals but also to their Local Bloom hub, motivating them to establish a local treasury for further community development. Open, transparent funding that doubles as a peer-to-peer knowledge sharing hub, so we learn from each other what is working, what challenges arise, and what measurement frameworks are effective. By leveraging Local Bloom DAOs as on-the-ground verifiers, we aim to expand access to institutional funds for smallholder projects by providing a regional aggregator.

If you contributed to Bloom Network last round, [claim your Hypercert here!](https://hypercerts.org/app/view/#claimId=0x822f17a9a5eecfd66dbaff7946a8071c265d1d07-18085327237114037456151433635783616902463488)

## 2024 Goal
**Integrate our smart contracts using smart wallets, onboard as many of our 30,000 on-the-ground members as we can, and train them to use Local DAOs to build and manage a treasury.** 

Total funding needed to complete this online platform and DAO/coop legal formation: 
$60,000 or equivalent voluntary labor contributions

üåüWe want your feedback: Do you want to see us put up a grant listing next round that goes straight into our regenerative action rewards pool, to be distributed to Local Bloom members doing the work on the ground?

## Join Our Team! üôåüèΩ
We are growing fast, but our small voluntary team of amazing women has hit a ceiling. This remains our primary challenge in implementing Bloom - we've learned that we need to broaden our membership base to include people in higher socioeconomic classes who have time to give to the global effort. We welcome you to join our community of professionals - [Bloomers Without Borders](https://bloomnetwork.earth-bloomers-without-borders/), to help us support the growth of Bloom's global platform and Local coalitions.

We are Local Bloom organizers - master community builders, local food system stewards, healers and cooperative business leaders. Our tech team works with major television networks and dOrg.tech building state-of-the-art, cross-platform cooperative technology. Our media team are professional journalists and marketers from Mumbai and Venezuela. We sincerely [welcome you to join our teams](https://bloomnetwork.earth/bloomers-without-borders). And we need your help in sharing our Gitcoin grant far and wide!

Team: Magenta Ceiba, Meg Rivers, Aishwarya Iyer, Anita Caldera, and 50+ local community organizers

Partners: Inverter Network, MetaGame, Giveth, Kolektivo, American Resiliency, dOrg

üåç Join in on this transformative journey ‚Äì visit [https://bloomnetwork.earth](https://bloomnetwork.earth/) and follow us on Twitter @ourbloomnetwork. We are making the infinite garden in real life! üåçüåüüôåüèΩ #BloomNetwork #ClimateAction #LocalChange
data.title: Bloom Network

data.description:
Bloom helps more people participate in local grassroots economic development through a feature-rich social network that helps on-the-ground actors share knowledge and incubate their projects. Governed as a federated DAO of Local Bloom nodes, we've built communities around the world since 2008, through regional food security, Indigenous solidarity, and alternative economies. [https://bloomnetwork.earth](https://bloomnetwork.earth/).

üëãüèΩ We are 33 Local Bloom hubs across 11 countries, and 30,000+ people on the ground. We've jumpstarted over 7,000 local urban and agroecology farms worldwide, 400+ community enterprises, and built permanent foundations for regenerative cultures. We have decades of experience building local economies.¬†

**The Challenge:** Financing decentralized and collaborative community labor is difficult. Local Bloom hubs are coalitions of interconnected projects, combining revenue-generating businesses, nonprofit initiatives, and mutual aid.

**Our Solution: The purpose of our CollabTech grant is to design a cooperative patronage token that any platform coop or federated DAO can use to incentivize cooperative business activity.** This builds on our Local Action Rewards protocol, which finances collaborative community labor and bioregional innovation. 

![GG20.jpg](https://i.postimg.cc/28vPZy0z/GG21.jpg)

*Rifai Sicilia, moringa agroforestry + mutual aid + web3 onboarding. Broadfield Enterprises, Uganda, African food and economic sovereignty.*

# Cooperative Patronage Token

üå∏ **Local Action Rewards** - How Bloomers earn our token now:

-   **Earn FLO (Flowers) / [X token]:** Local Bloom members earn FLO by documenting regenerative actions and the addresses of participants. (I.e., doing the value creation the network state wants to incentivize.)

-   **Impact Reporting Interface:** A user-friendly web2 UI allows rich image uploading and social networking features, making it easy for the public and peers to engage and learn.

-   **Grants Distribution:** Grants are distributed based on FLO earned, benefiting individuals and local treasuries. [Details.](https://bloomnetwork.earth/view/announcement-local-action-rewards-942c6454c17d)

Grants, as well as profits as the coop becomes profitable, are routed to the members on the ground who are doing the kinds of place-based labor that humanity needs to massively scale to mitigate climate impacts and solve common societal problems.

**What's Next - Your Grant Contribution:**

## We aim to enhance FLO with community currency properties to support local business discovery and economic development. We want to do this in connection with other network states.

For example, say I live in the Lisbon area. I have 300 FLO / [X network token] from helping plant a local food forest. I type that into the UI, and see offers from near me that I can receive in exchange for the token. I learn about local businesses near me who are values-aligned with this network.

![community-Currency-nodescrip.png](https://i.postimg.cc/cJY52P2q/community-Currency-nodescrip.png)

Who among us is maxed out on clients we can take on? Yet most of us are short on marketing capacity to get there. This mechanism allows us to share our surplus and establish relationships with potential customers. In this way, this token approach is designed to kickstart flywheels for bioregional economies. It does some of the heavy lifting of the initial marketing bootstrapping to get a business revenue-positive.

**Your funding will help us:**

-   Design a hybrid cooperative patronage token/community currency.

-   Research mechanisms for token backing and grants distribution. For example, perhaps the person I paid with my token is the one who gets the grant/profit distribution at the end of the period. [Inverter Network](https://www.inverter.network/#tokenization)'s bonding curves for token economies is another path we're considering.

-   Collaborate with other network states for interoperability. Examples: Cabin, ReFi DAO, Cohere Network, GreenPill, and Celo Regional Nodes.

-   Consult with [Grassroots Economics](https://www.grassrootseconomics.org/), Local Bloom organizers and Web3 protocol users.

**Importantly, this approach kickstarts regional economies. Imagine if you're able to work 4 hours per day at your tech job and earn money for 2 hours of your day doing gardening at your local agroforest to break up the screen time and touch grass.**

**Benefits of This Approach:**

-   **Legally above-board** as per cooperative legislation.
-   **Can be used by any network state**, DAO, or platform cooperative to route profits or grants to members for value-generating activities.
-   **Diverse Value Programming:**  what is eligible for funding from the company can be liberated from only building apps or products, to include social missions, with transparent and easily understandable reporting and accounting.
-   **Enhanced Governance:** Reputation scores can be used to assign Web3-native governance power, **increasing Web3's connectivity and leadership by real-world operators.**

## Budget

Threshold: $1,000. We need to and will do this work anyway. (We've been operating on voluntaryism due to difficulties raising capital for a women-led platform coop.) Having funds for it means we're better supported to complete it.

Stretch Goal: An additional $10,000 to finalize legal membership contracts for our Colorado Limited Cooperative Association entity and publish the legal documentation as a template.

# Why Bloom?


üë©‚ÄçüöÄ **Experienced Team:** Our platform team is 100% women-led with decades of experience in technology transformation.

üë©‚Äçüë©‚Äçüëß‚Äçüë¶  **Community Builders:** Local Bloom organizers have been building communities since 2008.

üåø  **Proven Impact:** We excel in achieving local food and economic sovereignty and are scaling low-cost, effective solutions with Web3 technology.

Transform the future of work by supporting our grant! ‚ù§Ô∏è

[Roadmap](https://drive.google.com/file/d/17dfUA0mtyOlDQcoowi5Ekd91Nrq39ZQh/view?usp=drive_link)

![northbay.jpg](https://i.postimg.cc/g2CfqSnL/northbay.jpg)

*Pictured: IntegriTea Cafe and community center, Vallejo*
data.title: Bloom Network: Cooperative Patronage Token Design for Network States

data.description:
Bloom helps more people participate in local grassroots climate action through a feature-rich social network that helps on-the-ground actors share knowledge and incubate their projects. Governed as a federated DAO of Local Bloom nodes, we've built communities around the world since 2008, through regional food security, Indigenous solidarity, and alternative economies. https://bloomnetwork.earth.

üëãüèΩ We are 33 Local Bloom hubs across 11 countries, and 30,000+ people on the ground. We've jumpstarted over 7,000 local urban and agroecology farms worldwide, 400+ community enterprises, and built permanent foundations for regenerative cultures. Our members have deep knowledge of how to achieve climate adaptation and watershed restoration, with decades of experience building local economies.

**The problem:** Community-led economic development tends to be invisible to philanthropy and social impact investing, because it is inherently collaborative, multi-issue, and builds power laterally.

**The solution: Local Action Rewards is a unique RPGF protocol that incentivizes communities to share their knowledge to finance their labor and scale bioregional innovation.**

[![5.jpg](https://i.postimg.cc/xjw3tw9R/5.jpg)](https://postimg.cc/V5FtNHrr)

*pictured: Broadfield Enterprises, Uganda, food security and African economic sovereignty*

# Local Action Rewards

üå∏ How It Works:

Local Bloom hubs and their members earn FLO (Flowers), our cooperative patronage token, by documenting the outcomes of their regenerative actions on a platform they collectively own and govern. This incentivizes IRL impactooors to share their knowledge and learn how to use Web3 tools. The public can easily read about the actions, allowing peers to learn and improve their own impact. Our social network, combining features of LinkedIn, Facebook, and Discord, supports effective mobilization around what is working well for climate adaptation and repair.

Each report is verified by at first our global grants team, and gradually more locally. FLO is then issued using Inverter Network's smart contracts.  **Bloom's grants pool, in stablecoin, is dispersed based on FLO earned in that period.** [Read more details](https://bloomnetwork.earth/view/announcement-local-action-rewards-942c6454c17d).

Benefits of this approach:

- **Kickstart flywheels for bioregional regenerative economies**, by issuing capital to communities that have limited access to any other means of obtaining it.

- **De-risk philanthropic contributions**, by documenting the impact before payment is issued.

- **Low international remittance fees** via stablecoin payouts enable micro payments at scale on globally.

- **Makes the unpaid labor being done by communities all over the world visible, and fundable.**

Local Action Rewards do not rely on popularity contest dynamics, or who has the largest marketing and outreach budget. Instead of one-time sale ecocredits, Bloomers' impact reports can be used to receive rewards from multiple ecosystems that are offering payment for real world impact. **The purpose is to route as much capital as possible into the hands of the people and communities doing the most highly scalable, cost-effective work to stabilize our climate and remedy common social problems.**

[Whitepaper summarizing our 16 years of global R&D.](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1xZFoS7EHlmPfnAKAOHdbK0FTHBMSrItO/view?usp=sharing) It outlines how the cooperative patronage token can be used for token-weighted voting in local DAO treasuries (as a measure of true investment and knowledge in local regeneration), and detailing impact reporting data interoperability for grants and investment decisions.

FLO can be used by other protocols as an on-chain marker of knowledge and experience in on-the-ground regenerative solutions, hopefully bringing more real world first wisdom keepers into the leadership structures of Web3.¬†

Starting with our second grants round, we are adding a second pool specifically for Indigenous-led regenerative actions, to address the fact that less than 1% of climate-related aid goes directly to Indigenous organizations, despite Indigenous communities stewarding 80% of the biodiversity on planet Earth.

**GG21 Contribution Allocation:**

- 90% to the Local Action Rewards pool.

- 10% to platform development and training, including crypto education, integrating a small wallet directly into our app so the impact report and FLO bounty claim are converged into one step.

We will deliver a report after our grant round ends September 30, with metrics such as new Web3 wallets created, amount of FLO issued, # of impact reports written and verified, # of members who joined, funds distributed, qualitative feedback from members, normalization formula utilized, and recommendations for round 2.

# What Now

üé° We are exploring ways to add community currency properties to FLO to support local business discovery, further utilizing [Inverter Network's](https://inverter.network) smart contracts.

For example, say I live in the Lisbon area. I have 300 FLO / [X network token] from helping plant a local food forest, or mentoring a local farmer in business skills. I can see offers from near me that I can receive in exchange for the token. I learn about local businesses near me who are values-aligned with this network. Perhaps the dividend goes to the person who accepted the FLO. Our next development is about researching this.

[![community-Currency-nodescrip.png](https://i.postimg.cc/cJY52P2q/community-Currency-nodescrip.png)](https://postimg.cc/1gmHN7yM)

# Goal

**Sponsors for the rewards pool are welcome. Our community could easily put $100M to effective use on proven local projects that are ready to scale, securing foodways and restoring watersheds for climate resilience.**

# Impact Since GG20

[Milestone reporting on Karma GAP](https://gap.karmahq.xyz/project/bloom-network/grants?tab=milestones-and-updates&grantId=0x4dec8c494dabd77b1712b4ce66cca5a0db244ef6d7462dc843a28282c61f012c). Highlights:

-   **Education:** Prepared educational materials and began onboarding our 30,000-person community onto Web3 via Bloom Network. Developed a Needs Assessment survey to help Local Bloom nodes write grants.

-   **Impact Reporting Interoperability:** Coded an API to pull impact reports from Bloom Network into Karma GAP, aiding Local Bloom projects in securing additional funding.

-   **Local Blooms' Impact:** Broadfield Enterprises Uganda [obtained EU and US organic certifications](https://bloomnetwork.earth/view/beu-organic-vanilla--376e25c4c1c1). Earthist planted another hemp field to [build community collaboration, enrich soil and biodiversity](https://bloomnetwork.earth/view/kendir-hemp-plantation--a-8b80c8354447). Diamante Bridge Collective deepened relationships with Boruca matriarch-led restoration efforts and transformational conferences in Costa Rica. They received their Precious Plastics Shredder to form [waste into usable materials](https://giveth.io/project/recenter-the-resource-recycling-center-san-salvador-0?tab=updates).

-   **[Three new Bloom nodes joined:** ](https://bloomnetwork.earth/engage/localBlooms)¬†Cooperativa Los Higuerones in Costa Rica, Northeastern US Bio-Economy Alliance, and Permatours.

-   **[Platform Enhancements](https://medium.com/@bloomnetwork/bloom-network-major-release-13-july-2024-e3afa0cf4f2c)**:: Customized Inverter Network's bounties app, added Global/Local toggle for social media timeline, integrated a Discord clone including dm's, introduced event listings, and launched "Digs" (Bloom's version of likes).

[![GG20.jpg](https://i.postimg.cc/Z5pN0n3t/GG20.jpg)](https://postimg.cc/w1xMG600)

*pictured: Ogallala Life, Texas, aquifer restoration. Rifai Sicilia, moringa agroforestry and web3 onboarding*

# Why Bloom?

üë©‚ÄçüöÄ Our platform team is 100% women-led, with decades of experience leading technology transformation!

üë©‚Äçüë©‚Äçüëß‚Äçüë¶ Local Bloom Organizers have been building communities together since 2008!

üåø Bloom Network excels at achieving local food and economic sovereignty. Combined with Web3, we are rapidly scaling low-cost, proven solutions with low international remittance fees for mass mobilization.

We welcome you to contribute to this grants mechanism to support the profound work being done by Local Bloom hubs all over the world! ‚ù§Ô∏è

[Roadmap](https://drive.google.com/file/d/17dfUA0mtyOlDQcoowi5Ekd91Nrq39ZQh/view?usp=drive_link)

[![northbay.jpg](https://i.postimg.cc/g2CfqSnL/northbay.jpg)](https://postimg.cc/68hjBhVB)

*IntegriTea Cafe and community center, Vallejo*
data.title: Bloom Network Local Action Rewards
OpenCivics Genesis Round
data.description: The OpenCivics Genesis Round is the first grant round of the OpenCivics consortium, and the first quadratic funding grants program focused on civics and advocacy projects. This funding is intended to help jumpstart the decentralized civics sector, with the consortium providing a hub for ongoing collaboration between participating projects.

data.name: OpenCivics
data.description:
This OpenCivics Consortium Round seeks to fund critical collaborative protocols, prototypes, and infrastructures that enable civic engagement and interoperable civic utilities for direct governance and stewardship of our communities and commons. We see these collaborative methods and prototypes as critically underfunded force multipliers for multi-agent coordination on key systemic leverage points that create deep social change. 

Ideal applicants will be engaged in developing technology, applied research, and social processes related to collaboration and coordination for collective action. Projects may address the diverse stack of collaborative protocols needed for successful multi-agent coordination such as: identity and attestation, on-chain delegation and roles, decentralized project management, fundraising and allocation, systems-aware strategic alignment processes, measurement and evaluation, and participatory governance and learning. These efforts may be theoretical and research-based or may be applied contexts of collaboration whose successful actualization could lead to protocolization of key activities and collaborative functions.  

For additional definitions and application details, please visit https://go.opencivics.co/wiki

data.name: $EARTH
data.description: $EARTH - Digital currency backed by real world climate solutions, ecosystem services and solarpunk values

Grants in this round are primarily focused on climate solutions (the group may do other work, but the grant proposal must be directly related to climate solutions). The projects are explicitly helping to reduce GHGs, and/or serve as an important core infrastructure for web3 climate solution

data.name: Climate Coordination Network
data.description: Climate Coordination Network

Bloom Network's Local Action Rewards is used to track labor time contributed to local regenerative climate adaptation work done among vetted Local Bloom hubs around the world, to make the work more visible and fundable. 

We use a reputation token on Optimism, with Grants Pools that are distributed proportional to reward claims. These pools are multi-chain compatible, and we would like to start a Celo pool, to additionally onboard our members to Celo so they can be introduced to MRV and other apps on Celo that may be a good fit for their activities, and because we are values and mission-aligned with the Celo ecosystem.

We are already partnering with Silvi, with active pilots in two hubs so far. Members record their agroforestry activities on Silvi, then in their Impact Report on Bloom, which is publicly visible and easily readable on Bloom Network's media website, they show their Silvi data and summarize the time each of their members spent planting and coordination the action. The first demonstration of this collaboration will happen during our first round of this unique retroactive public goods funding mechanism, June - August 2024. Silvi and Bloom plan to further integrate our two apps to make it easier for projects to utilize both with minimal effort.

Silvi is just one example. We are also in dialogue with Radiical Systems' peer-to-peer credit protocol, and open to more Celo collaborations.

One of Bloom Network's cofounders, Meg Rivers, is a professional technology trainer, and we've begun rolling out Web3 onboarding to our 30,000 person on-the-ground community with a training designed for extremely non-technical people who first need to understand what cryptocurrency is, and why they should use it. We are already teaching our community about Celo through this process, and will scale up this training as we build outreach capacity over the coming year.

[bloomBounties.jpg](https://storage.tally.so/private/bloomBounties.jpg?id=K5xLWD&accessToken=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJpZCI6Iks1eExXRCIsImZvcm1JZCI6Ind2Tk5KZyIsImlhdCI6MTcxNTM0ODc4OH0.vq4zXmC4qpFH_8xV2YUOpSEcEa3i2L1GJOa0mb-AjlY&signature=2ab4f39d83716f66d13e059f3456fd59d54b829fafb014a7d49e923ad17c478e) [bloomBounties2.jpg](https://storage.tally.so/private/bloomBounties2.jpg?id=VQPVxj&accessToken=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJpZCI6IlZRUFZ4aiIsImZvcm1JZCI6Ind2Tk5KZyIsImlhdCI6MTcxNTM0ODc4OH0.qYT0QWO9YvZIudHH8PTt9MbLXYCUOW5n7GihjR5MPZE&signature=1d4001c954c2c0a7fd3cb9ba6af625a8d177e506b167c6a359b72997bc60f5eb) [silvibloomcollab.jpg](https://storage.tally.so/private/silvibloomcollab.jpg?id=xMD2ov&accessToken=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJpZCI6InhNRDJvdiIsImZvcm1JZCI6Ind2Tk5KZyIsImlhdCI6MTcxNTM0ODc4OH0.ItjPfodjXZdtbu-kgTswNbRGtQmVvN630XBhmvXuVlw&signature=9a86d258d6355d7277e143c75e8f9f82734bb32bb36ae97f3d46d0efe94f969f) -

data.description: What is Cryptocurrency and How Do I Get Started is a training our team designed in Q1-Q2 for newcomers to blockchain, oriented toward extremely non-technical users. This milestone is to complete editing a recording of a live session and post it toy Youtube so Bloom Network members and anyone anywhere can learn how to use a wallet, including Celo for cases where they need to use a wallet through an interface like Metamask.
data.title: Publish Cryptocurrency training on Youtube

data.reason:
This training recording is now published as of June 27. ["What is Cryptocurrency and How Do I Get Started"](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EXuUOZuhCfY&t=3s)

Additionally, the rewards launch materials have been prepared. We are currently waiting for the Inverter Network contracts to be released before publicizing the program. We will then host another live training, and again in October after the funds are released, we will host live trainings to teach Bloomers how accept and utilize their cUSD using Celo.

- Easy [Helper UI](https://bloomnetwork.earth/member/localactionrewards) for all Bloom Network members

This training recording is now published. ["What is Cryptocurrency and How Do I Get Started"](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EXuUOZuhCfY&t=3s)

Additionally, the rewards launch materials have been prepared. We are currently waiting for the Inverter Network contracts to be released before publicizing the program. We will then host another live training, and again in October after the funds are released, we will host live trainings to teach Bloomers how accept and utilize their cUSD using Celo.

- [Announcement](https://bloomnetwork.earth/view/announcement-local-action-rewards-942c6454c17d)
- [Slideshow](https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1ZwdbussGC-m6snHxXaiHYS7QAr-d_yfn0eeG7YhkuqE/edit?usp=sharing) for Local Bloom leaders
- Easy [Helper UI](https://bloomnetwork.earth/member/localactionrewards) for all Bloom Network members

data.description: Distribute 90% of cUSD received in GG20, through our Local Action Rewards. Some of that will go to Rifai Sicilia, Diamante Bridge Collective, and Bloom Northeast US - these are Local Bloom hubs that are utilizing Silvi now or will be in Fall 2024. Through this distribution, Bloom members will be introduced to Celo as one of their first experiences with using cryptocurrency.
data.title: Distribute cUSD through our Local Action Rewards

data.description: Silvi collaboration first test run. Guiding Rifai Sicilia to include their Silvi data in their impact reports on Bloom Network, as a first step toward understanding how Silvi and Bloom can integrate together.
data.title: Silvi collaboration first test run

data.name: Celo Public Goods
data.description: Celo is scaling Ethereum with real-world solutions, leading a thriving new digital economy for all

Since Bloom is a federated DAO of Local Hubs, who together govern and code our social platform, we are including an on-the-ground impact summary. This will get more detailed as more people onboard to Bloom's impact reporting platform during our first Local Action Rewards round, now through September 30. We will be automatically pushing Local Bloom's impact reports into Karma GAP for interoperability. But our community needs the image rich, public media interface in order to best learn from one another.

data.reason:
Links to proof / documentation are included below:

- Broadfield Enterprises Uganda obtained their [EU and US organic certifications](https://bloomnetwork.earth/view/beu-organic-vanilla--376e25c4c1c1) for their community-grown export crops.
- [Rifai Sicilia](https://x.com/RifaiSicilia) completed greenhouse and irrigation infrastructure upgrades for their agroforestry farming and hosted several educational events about food, herbalism, and web3 including Silvi‚Äôs tree MRV app. They also got local press coverage for their forest fire guardianship. In Costa Rica,
- Diamante Bridge Collective [supported Boruca matriarch-led restoration and preservation efforts](https://giveth.io/project/diamante-bridge-collective-0?tab=updates), and participated in local transformational conferences, deepening and strengthening relations across cultures. They started a mentorship program for local projects. Their [recycling center](https://giveth.io/project/recenter-the-resource-recycling-center-san-salvador-0?tab=updates) received their Precious Plastic Shredder to  melt and reform plastics. Tim wrote a [beautiful overall summary of their journey and impact to date](https://forum.diamantebridge.org/t/collective-myth-creation-part-1-diamante-luz-and-dbc-commons/214).
- [3 New Local Bloom nodes joined](https://bloomnetwork.earth/engage/localBlooms) - Cooperativa Los Higuerones in Costa Rica, Northeastern US Bio-Economy Alliance (a bioregional scale Bloom node), and Permatours, a nomadic Bloom that produces educational permaculture events for mutual aid and workforce training.
- Tribes and Natures Defenders continue to reach out to find partners to protect their lands from being bought out for extractive development and mining. Bloom Northeast US was able to find some leads on orgs that work in Southeast Asia supporting land purchasing into tribal ownership, through LinkedIn networking.
- Ogallala Life in Texas met with Joe Brewer from the Design School for Regenerating Earth, toward a bioregional activation, and their lead organizer connected Joe and Bloom's lead global organizer to meet each other and better connect our two networks' efforts.

data.description:
This is a milestone from a different grant, but we want to document it here because it's relevant for cross-platform and cross-community interoperability.

Thanks to a grant from ReFi in Arbitrum, we have begun an API integration with Karma GAP, so that Local Bloom hubs' impact reports can be pushed into Karma GAP on-chain, to assist Local Bloom hubs in applying for Gitcoin grants and having on-chain attestations.

This way, they can use a familiar web 2 interface that allows them to also upload rich pictures and storytelling to assist peer-to-peer learning and increase public participation and discovery of their work, while also being able to connect with web3 financial rails.

As they get set up on Gitcoin and other ecosystems, they'll be able to push their report once and have it show up in the different places it needs to go. The premise we're going on here is that Karma GAP has a minimum number of consistent fields, while Bloom Network requires some additional fields to be entered. A next steps is for this connection to work both ways. This part of a broader effort among web3 IRL communities to interoperate our reporting systems.
data.title: Bloom Network's external API for our impact reports

data.reason: Completed: External API of Local Actions reported on Bloom Network. Now in review by the Karma GAP team for any additions or modifications needed for interoperability.
Completed: External API of Local Actions reported on Bloom Network. Now in review by the Karma GAP team for any additions or modifications needed for interoperability.

data.description:
On July 9 we hosted our monthly Local Blooms Leadership Call, where we trained our on-the-ground organizers how to participate in our RPGF program where they receive payment for regenerative actions they do that are reported on Bloom Network and verified by a reviewer. This used the materials prepared in June and reported in our June milestones.

We also rewrote our Announcement Article to be more high level so our partners and sponsors can better understand why we made this special funding mechanism, and where we are headed with it.

We are now actively onboarding Bloom members into our social network. Mostly we're at the stage of folks setting up their profile, and during our August Leadership Call we hope to guide more people to putting their impact reports online.
data.title: Host initial live training with Local Bloom hubs on how to participate in our Local Action Rewards

data.reason:
Completed: trained on-the-ground organizers how to use our Local Action Rewards program Completed: Revision of our rewards Announcement Article, to maximize understanding of Bloom's unique retro funding mechanism among web3 peers and partners. 

Additional Success: Our [weekly office hours](https://bloomnetwork.earth/engage/communityCalls) have now successfully provided generalized web3 onboarding support for our members. In addition to Bloom Network specifics, members have attended to ask questions about Gitcoin passport and general best practices for using personal vs organizational wallets.

In preparation for our Local Action Rewards Launch, Bloom Network's unique retroactive public goods funding mechanism that rewards members of Local Bloom hubs for doing on-the-ground regenerative actions such as contributing to establishing resilience local food systems, watershed care, ecological restoration, and community care. The purpose of this program is to get funding into the hard-to-finance grassroots, community-led layer of climate adaptation.

data.name: OpenCivics
data.description:
This OpenCivics Consortium Round seeks to fund critical collaborative protocols, prototypes, and infrastructures that enable civic engagement and interoperable civic utilities for direct governance and stewardship of our communities and commons. We see these collaborative methods and prototypes as critically underfunded force multipliers for multi-agent coordination on key systemic leverage points that create deep social change. 

Ideal applicants will be engaged in developing technology, applied research, and social processes related to collaboration and coordination for collective action. Projects may address the diverse stack of collaborative protocols needed for successful multi-agent coordination such as: identity and attestation, on-chain delegation and roles, decentralized project management, fundraising and allocation, systems-aware strategic alignment processes, measurement and evaluation, and participatory governance and learning. These efforts may be theoretical and research-based or may be applied contexts of collaboration whose successful actualization could lead to protocolization of key activities and collaborative functions.  

For additional definitions and application details, please visit https://go.opencivics.co/wiki

Since Bloom is a federated DAO of Local Hubs, who together govern and code our social platform, we are including an on-the-ground impact summary. This will get more detailed as more people onboard to Bloom's impact reporting platform during our first Local Action Rewards round, now through September 30. We will be automatically pushing Local Bloom's impact reports into Karma GAP for interoperability. But our community needs the image rich, public media interface in order to best learn from one another.
data.title: Local Bloom Nodes' Impact between GG20 and GG21

data.name: Gitcoin
data.description: Gitcoin creates solutions that empower digitally native communities to fund, build, and protect what matters.

data.name: Climate Coordination Network
data.description: Climate Coordination Network

questions.query: If applicable, describe how your project/community has been utilising or supporting the Celo ecosystem, or explain a roadmap for your plans to utilise, build with, or align with Celo.
questions.explanation: We would like to deploy our new version of FLO (Flowers) on Celo. Inverter Network, whose bounties contracts we use for the Local Action Rewards and FLO issuance, is open to deploying on Celo. We will wait until you gaias release on mainnet with the Superchain, but that timing will sync with when we complete our upgraded token design. Additionally, we plan to integrate with Silvi's agroforestry app so Local Bloom hubs can automatically link their Silvi data in their impact reports. This is a prototypical integration of how as a broader community of cosmo-local nodes, we can federate the detailed MRV reporting tools with more general public-facing readability for mainstream adoption and financial support.

data.name: Regen Coordination
data.description: The Regen Coordination Round is a proposal for a GG21 community round centered on the themes of Coordi-nations 3, Cosmo-localism 2, Bio-Regionalism 3, and Regenerative Finance (ReFi) 3. Bringing together GreenPill Network 1, ReFi DAO 1, Celo Regional DAOs 1 and Regens Unite 1, we aim to support a global movement of regenerative communities leveraging Web3 for real-world impact and addressing local needs. The round will feed into a program to support the further development of local community impact tracking methodologies, grant tooling interoperability, and integrated QF & RPGF. We have currently secured $60K in funding from Celo Public Goods, ReFi DAO and Greenpill and ask for Gitcoin‚Äôs backing as we embark on a shared mission to showcase how community coordination, Web3, and innovative financial mechanisms can enable ecological and social regeneration on a global scale.

questions.query: Project GitHub Repo
questions.explanation: https://github.com/BloomNetwork/blooming

questions.query: Have you participated in a previous Gitcoin Grants Round? If so, please name the rounds or link the builder profile associated with previous rounds.
questions.explanation: Yes, since 2020. OSS, Climate, Regen Coordination, Open Civics

questions.query: How does your project contribute to the growth of the OSS ecosystem? Please provide specific examples of how your application enhances or expands the current ecosystem.
questions.explanation: We are contributing to the accessibility of web3 to extremely non-technical adopters, by using Capsule Wallet, Inverter Network‚Äôs bounties contracts, and providing detailed feedback and design guidance to both of those composable apps and their teams. Our existing community is 30,000 people on the ground, and we‚Äôve actively onboarding the first set, including 100 prominent community leaders from around the world. We have created wallet trainings and ‚Äúwhat and why blockchain‚Äù educational materials for on-the-ground Infinite Garden builders, and are actively supporting them to contribute to leading the ongoing development of Ethereum OSS so it‚Äôs accessible to highly non-technical, locally rooted participants. Our open source governance protocols for bioregional regenerative and place-based DAO ownership of infrastructure, supports real world integration and wise growth.

questions.query: What features or use cases does your dApp/App present? How is it differentiated?
questions.explanation:
Our bounty dApp makes Ethereum bounties accessible to on-the-ground leaders who are already making The Infinite Garden in real life. It allows them to self-define what has beneficial impact and share that with one another to build capacity to make their innovations visible, replicable, and legible to peers and to funders.

Our social platform connects local efforts to volunteers that want to get involved in systems transformation, offers potential role suggestions to create a functional community, and represents a media outlet to fundraise and validate food transformation efforts. It includes gifts, needs, and skill matching, templates for actions that communities can do, templates for forming a team and growing a project, and a built-in discord clone. Importantly, it is governed and planned to be owned by Local Bloom hubs around the world as a federated cooperative using the Colorado Limited Cooperative Association run as a DAO. Social media that is owned and governed by place-based communities, web2/web3 hybrid.

questions.query: What are your plans for further development, and how will the grant funds be used to achieve these goals?
questions.explanation: Our next steps are to integrate the bounty contracts directly into our reporting app so it‚Äôs easier for local organizers to select participants in their local actions and automatically include their wallet addresses. This will save them a lot of time. We also need to improve the performance of our social app so it loads easier on mobile and reduces the data plan expense for those in the Global South. We run a quarterly RPGF round called Local Action Rewards as described in our application. We are continuing to give feedback and design input to the Capsule and Inverter Network teams.

data.name: Regen Coordination
data.description: The Regen Coordination Round is a proposal for a GG21 community round centered on the themes of Coordi-nations 3, Cosmo-localism 2, Bio-Regionalism 3, and Regenerative Finance (ReFi) 3. Bringing together GreenPill Network 1, ReFi DAO 1, Celo Regional DAOs 1 and Regens Unite 1, we aim to support a global movement of regenerative communities leveraging Web3 for real-world impact and addressing local needs. The round will feed into a program to support the further development of local community impact tracking methodologies, grant tooling interoperability, and integrated QF & RPGF. We have currently secured $60K in funding from Celo Public Goods, ReFi DAO and Greenpill and ask for Gitcoin‚Äôs backing as we embark on a shared mission to showcase how community coordination, Web3, and innovative financial mechanisms can enable ecological and social regeneration on a global scale.

questions.query: How does your project contribute to the growth of the OSS ecosystem? Please provide specific examples of how your application enhances or expands the current ecosystem.
questions.explanation:
Our project enhances the open-source ecosystem by making Web3 accessible to non-technical users and expanding decentralized governance models for real-world communities. We helped develop Inverter Network‚Äôs bounty contracts, bounties dApp, and Control Room interface for non-smart contract developers to be able to deploy a bounties workflow. We developed a forkable, novel approach to Retroactive Public Goods Funding, using labor hours done and verified among relational networks in real life, to determine the distribution of a grants pool. That is documented in our Regenerative Economic Protocol - https://bloomnetwork.earth/learn/whitepaper. 

Additionally, we‚Äôve open-sourced our Decentralized Federated Governance Model, which can be adopted by any Web3 project to support bioregional DAOs and community-led infrastructure ownership. Our community of over 30,000 people, including 300+ grassroots leaders, is actively onboarding to Web3 through our wallet trainings and blockchain education. While our content management system is not currently open source due to security concerns, we ensure meaningful contributions by strengthening key Web3 infrastructure and governance protocols that others can adopt. We hope that our contributions encourage the Ethereum ecosystem to grow the Infinite Garden by collaborating with and supporting real world communities growing community gardens and economic sovereignty.

questions.query: What features or use cases does your dApp/App present? How is it differentiated?
questions.explanation: Our app is a full-featured social network that uses Inverter Network‚Äôs smart contracts integrated with a user-friendly web2-like interface. It makes Ethereum bounties accessible to on-the-ground activists who are highly non-technical. Using Para wallet, members can create their first Web3 wallet with fewer hurdles, empowering them to access the decentralized finance tools available on Ethereum which are best-suited to the community coalition-based way they organize on the ground. Our impact reporting form allows them to document their local community actions doing climate, economic sovereignty and mutual aid, in a place that is accessible and readable for the public, yet on-chain, with frictionless experience. Our platform also supports public knowledge sharing, from sharing templates for how to start a crop swap, to how to do participatory budgeting using a DAO, and more, so that people can fork and replicate successful community actions. Grant funds and eventually cooperative profits go to people doing critical work on the ground that is hard to fund through centralized finance, through our novel form of retroactive funding, based on labor hours contributed to local actions.  Lastly, we are forming as a federated cooperative, so the platform is co-owned and governed by local coalitions in real communities. This presents a novel way to run any kind of public infrastructure as a DAO owned by real, in person communities who are accountable to the people and ecosystems where they live.

questions.query: What are your plans for further development, and how will the grant funds be used to achieve these goals?
questions.explanation: This year we are focused on expanding outreach & visibility to bring more people into the movement. Our goal is to grow to 100 local Bloom nodes and 1,000 members this year, and to grow the amount of funds we are channeling to local climate adaptation, currently at approximately $12,000 per quarter. We also plan to improve the performance (speed) of our app to increase accessibility for rural and Global South participants.

questions.query: How is the project CollabTech?
questions.explanation: The purpose of our CollabTech grant is to design a cooperative patronage token that any platform coop or federated DAO can use to incentivize cooperative business activity by routing profits or grants to members for value-generating activities. It also enhances collaborative governance: Reputation scores can be used to assign Web3-native governance power, increasing Web3‚Äôs connectivity and leadership by real-world operators. The project will be done in communication with other network states for interoperability, for example: Cabin, ReFi DAO, Cohere Network, GreenPill, and Celo Regional Nodes.

questions.query: Who's the targeted user group and what's the need/problem being addressed?
questions.explanation: The targeted user group is network states and platform cooperatives, although any business can use this token approach to include social impact labor in its business model. The problem addressed is that financing decentralized and collaborative community-led development is difficult, with nearly no solutions operating at the scale of need.

questions.query: How do you ensure value keeps being delivered after the round is over? (How will the project become commercially sustainable or a perennial good? )
questions.explanation: Bloom Network receives ongoing grant funding from other rounds and we have a grants team working on traditional grants. Additionally, our media cooperative is designed to be revenue-positive over time.

questions.query: How long will it take after funding is received to deliver value? (share a high level timeline)
questions.explanation: Month 3: We will deliver the research scoped for this grant. It can then be immediately shared to other projects who need to solve this problem soon. Month 6: depending on resources and voluntary labor available to us, we will deploy the token with community currency properties. EOY 1: Data demonstrating solid bioregional business network growth, showing that this approach works and can be scaled to more DAOs and supported by traditional philanthropy and corporate CSR programs.

questions.query: How does your project contribute to the advancement of the Web3 grants ecosystem?
questions.explanation: Research on grant program design and effectiveness, Development of Web3 Grants tooling, Experiments with innovative funding mechanisms, Other

questions.query: Describe your previous work or plans related to the Web3 grants ecosystem.
questions.explanation: See our grants listing for details. Our team members have also developed DAO Drops and taught on Gitcoin's Easy RPGF classes. Since 2011 we have been researching and inventing how to fund holistic grassroots community organizer labor. Now that Web3 UX is usable enough for highly non-technical people such as farmers, we have meshed our research on how to bootstrap bioregional economies, how to fund the people who seem to be impossible to fund right now, and on-chain bounties for an on-the-ground community-led Web3 grants approach.

questions.query: How does your project create value for the Web3 grants ecosystem?
questions.explanation: We present a reputation token that can value the knowledge of primarily IRL leaders, which is important for the "next billion" adoption of Web3. Our project is a novel way to fund grassroots communities, that any DAO, protocol, or grants community can implement, contribute to, or interoperate with. Lastly it's a pathway to finance The Infinite Garden for real, using Web3 grants.

questions.query: Describe your team's expertise in your chosen focus area within Web3 grants. Include relevant experience, publications, or past projects.
questions.explanation: Magenta Ceiba is a co-founder of DAO Drops, an experiment in Web3 grants that uses on-chain data to ascertain who would be informed decision makers for grants allocation, as well as amazing UX that makes the grants process fun. https://daodrops.io She has also participated in and researched multi-stakeholder governance processes for funding distribution across movement coalitions, where grantees and funders together strategize around most effective use of the funds. The experience informs her contributions to Web3 grants. Lastly, she was a first beta tester for Giveth as well as their first marketing copywriter, alongside fellow Bloom co-founder Danibelle Gennety of Giveth and a Local Bloom hub in Costa Rica. Danibelle has decades of experience with community fund allocation and general decision-making and conflict resolution, as well as decades of experience in traditional philanthropy via working for the Gates Foundation. 12 co-founders of Bloom Network developed a global decentralized governance model that is designed to be resilient against power abuse. Our Web3 grants model is engineered to power that governance model and maintain place-based wise governance by real communities. Together, along with members of dOrg, we have discussed using algorithmic governance and on-chain data to assist with forming governing bodies representing diverse knowledge and diverse affected stakeholder. Down the road we'll likely use something like Hats Protocol to run that. Lastly, we worked with an all-female legal team at Jason Weiner for two years to encode our governance model into a federated cooperative/DAO as a Colorado Limited Cooperative Association. It was the only way we found for the network infrastructure to truly be internationally owned, and for the token part of our grants system to be legally above board across borders.

questions.query: How do you plan to share insights, methodologies, or tools developed through your project with the Cartographer Syndicate and the broader Web3 grants community?
questions.explanation: We will publish a report after our first grant round (on now) ends, September 30. It will summarize findings and metrics as outlined in our grant listing, as well as recommendations for Round 2 and for other network states or grants communities who are interested in using a similar approach.
